results.title: Mother infant interaction: forms of feeding at six weeks
results.creator_credit: Sylvia Brody, Film-Rite and New York Infant Development Project
results.brief_description: This film shows over one hundred infants and their mothers who were studied to try and work out a pattern of behaviour during the baby’s feeding. Seven types were noticed within the schema of empathy, control and efficiency. Those mothers who showed positive signs of all of these did best. Many mothers showed little sensitivity to the needs of their babies and this was still obvious a year later.

results.title: Mosaic
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Lambart, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A picture of unusual movement, colour and sound, created in a unusual way. It is an example of “op” art in film, a play on the retina of the eye. Basis of the film is a single tiny square that divides, eventually forming a colourful mosaic to the animators musical orchestration. (Awards: New York; Melbourne; Buenos Aires; Vancouver.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Evelyn Lambart, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Morning miracle
results.brief_description: The story behind the morning delivery of milk to some 2 million homes. The milk is transported in bulk from the farms to the depot where the process of pasteurisation and bottling takes place. Tests for fat content and purity are constant through every stage. The nation’s health and security are greatly dependent on a reliable supply of fresh pure milk.

results.title: Morning in the streets
results.creator_credit: Denis Mitchell, Roy Harris and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: An impression of life and opinion in the back streets of a northern industrial city in England, showing the warmth, the vitality and humor. In the early morning the streets are drab and wet but gradually they awaken, to human sounds and movements. The film ends at midday when the children come out of school, their shouts and songs drowning the voices of the old. (Award: Italia)

results.title: More by design
results.creator_credit: David Cammell, Jean Wadlow, Charles Barker Films and Clydesdale Bank
results.brief_description: Design plays an important part in our lives, and this film has been made to show the remarkable breadth, variety and ingenuity of design which gives colour, form and dimension to everyday life in Scotland. Interviews with Scottish designers who give their opinions on design are mixed with use of design in the manufacture of tapestry, pottery and jewellery and renovation of an ancient castle. Commentary by Magnus Magnusson.

results.title: Morality: the process of moral development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roy Anthony Cox, Marcus Krigbaum, Davidson Films and Eclipse Films (US)
results.brief_description: Dr Susan Merrsemen-Warren and Dr Elliot Turiel interview and test children from the age of four until early adulthood in order to examine their concepts of sharing, fairness, justice, and other attitudes linked to the process of moral development.

results.title: Mom, why won't you listen?
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which provides role-playing situations designed to help teenagers in getting their parents to listen and respond to them. Is it a matter of picking the right moment and approach, or is it something deeper? What can each son or daughter do about it?

results.title: Modern weather theory. Part 2. Structure of storms
results.brief_description: This film uses animation and maps to explain normal weather conditions and the atmosphere that creates the prevailing winds. Maps and diagrams also show the zones of the prevailing westerlies, and trade winds, and the way in which warm moist air rises, cools by expansion, loses its moisture by precipitation, and so on.

results.title: Modern France: the land and the people
results.brief_description: A brief geographical survey of modern France. Covers wheat farming in the North; flower gathering and orange growing on the Riviera; vineyards around Bordeaux; life at the port of Bordeaux; travel by barge on the Seine to Paris; the markets and shops of Paris; a steel-mill in Nancy.
